yorkshire spinners colourlab sock dk * repeat the instructions following the single asterisk as directed jazz 1198 work instructions within brackets 1 x 150g as many times as directed work instructions within brackets for a specific size measurements 0 no stitches or times to fit ball of foot circumference cont continue dpn s double pointed needle s cm 20 22 23 24 in 8 8½ 9 9½ k knit k2tog knit 2 together equipment p purl p2tog purl 2 together three options for needles patt pattern one 3 5mm uk9 10/us4 short circular needle and one set of 3 5mm uk9-10/us4 dpns repeat repeat or one set of 3 5mm uk9 10/us4 dpns round s round s or one 3 5mm uk9 10/us4 80cm long circular needle sl1p slip 1 stitch purlwise ssk slip a stitch knitwise and return to left for a looser cuff needle k2tog through back of loops one set of size 4mm uk8/us6 dpns st s stitch es decrease together stitch holder optional two stitch markers wool needle ddkk gauge 4mm us6 24 sts to 10cm over stocking stitch worked in the round on 3 5mm needles always use the size of needles to get the gauge 337 367 150g 10cm/4″sq correct gauge metres yards ball it is essential to work to the stated gauge to ensure success pattern notes 22 sts these socks are knitted on 3 5mm needles not 4mm as stated on the ball band this will produce a different gauge but will ensure a firmer more hard-wearing fabric for your socks the ideal gauge for these socks is 24 stitches to 10cm 4in so use whatever size needles are required to reach that gauge and do check that your knitted fabric is firm but not stiff when working from a chart you will read all rounds from right to left swor 82 level 75% british wool / 25% nylon 4mm us6 reshape whilst damp do not tumble dry made in accordance with bs984 75% wool / wolle / lana / laine / ull / villa 25% nylon / polyamid / poliamida / polyamide / polyamid / polyamidi 1 sound waves socks 4th size rnds 1 3 knit 52 sts rnds 4 k4 p4 k8 p4 k10 p4 k8 p4 k6 cuff rnds 5 k3 p1 k4 p1
